title: Semantik Architect Frame Schema: Astronomical Object
description:
JSON schema for `entity.astronomical_object` frames used by the Semantik Architect CLI and AW bridge.

The schema describes the normalized payload that will be converted into an internal `AstronomicalObjectFrame`.

frame_type.description: Canonical frame type identifier. Must be `entity.astronomical_object`.

mass_kg.description: Approximate mass in kilograms, if known.

radius_km.description: Approximate mean radius in kilometres, if known.

orbital_period_days.description: Orbital period in Earth days, when applicable (e.g. planets, moons).

semi_major_axis_au.description: Semi-major axis in astronomical units, when applicable.

distance_ly.description: Distance from Earth in light-years, when applicable.

constellation.description: Constellation in which the object is observed (IAU-style name), when applicable.

attributes.description:
Optional attribute bag used for secondary facts and domain-specific keys.

Recommended keys for astronomical objects include:
- `discovery_event` (EventRef): discovery / first observation event.
- `spectral_type` (string): spectral classification, e.g. 'G2V'.
- `host_star` (EntityRef): host star for exoplanets.
- `satellites` (array[EntityRef]): known satellites / moons.

Callers MAY provide additional keys; they will be passed through to the semantics layer.

extra.description: Opaque source-specific metadata not interpreted by the core semantics/NLG layer. Use this to carry original IDs, raw fields, or debugging information.

EntityRef.description: Lightweight reference to an entity in the Semantik Architect knowledge graph or an external source. At least one identifier (`id`, `qid`, or `name`) SHOULD be provided.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the entity (database or graph ID).

qid.description: Optional Wikidata QID, e.g. 'Q2' for Earth.

name.description: Surface name of the entity in a reference language.

lang.description: Optional BCP-47-like language tag for `name`, e.g. 'en', 'fr'.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the entity reference.

TimeSpan.description: Approximate or exact time span for an event. All fields are optional; callers may encode a single point (`point`) or an interval (`start`/`end`).

start.description: Start of the interval in ISO-8601 form, e.g. '1995-01-01' or '1995-01-01T00:00:00Z'.

end.description: End of the interval in ISO-8601 form.

point.description: Instantaneous timestamp in ISO-8601 form when appropriate.

EventRef.description: Lightweight representation or reference for an event. Used here primarily for discovery events.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the event (database or graph ID).

name.description: Short human-readable label for the event.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the event reference.
